filpkart.comment: After ordering this phone I was panicking a bit since there are a lot of reviews complaining of problems. It seemed like a luck of draw that I would receive a not-so-problematic device. I almost cancelled my order but then thought, meh. It was delivered within 24 hours to me, that is clearly a plus point for flipkart. Not for the phone (all those people out there who rate a product low because flipkart messed up your delivery). I have to say the first night I used it, it seemed like that I received a defective piece, with poor earphone volume, poor speaker volume and a really bad battery. And the metal strip almost burned my ear. If that had gone for two-three more days, I would have just returned the damn thing. However, it's been almost 10 days now and the battery is a powerhouse, I have to say. I'm getting a ~14-15 hours battery backup on an all-time-3G, all-syncs-on, ~1 hour web browsing and IM. And it stays at a working temperature of 30-35 C. The screen performs unexpectedly well in even very bright sunlight. As far as that goes, I'm having almost the same experience as my previous lumia 720 (which used to give me battery backup of ~20-22 hours though. Eh, well!) As of now, I am having no issues with calling (both cellular and voip) although the sound system could've been made a bit more better. But it works, no static, no unexpected drops, no so-called hissing noise. The camera is okay. I didn't expect the front camera to be good but it actually turned out to be really good. However, although it's true for almost any phone, cameras in Nokia Lumia work better even when they are of less resolution. My lumia 720's 6.7MP worked better than this one's 8MP. But don't let a not-so-good camera stop you from buying this. I'm not going to state the obvious android issues and advantages. I don't do heavy gaming or anything, so I don't know whether the RAM is enough. My opinion: If you want to stick to ~12-14k, buy this one. Otherwise shell out a few more bucks and get a One Plus One.

Battery backup is also very good...I am using it since 9 am today and doing all sort of things(played games, watched videos, made video calls, browsing, listening songs online,checked mails) and still i am having 30% battery left. I ordered this along with original Moto flip cover and 32GB Class 10 sandisk ultra memory card. With the flip cover the phone looks much beautiful than naked...;p. Along with the 32GB memory card this has become a beast in terms of storage (combined u will get massive 42 GB for ur use.) I was reading other user's review also and some of them had mentioned that charger is getting hot like a rock...but i haven't felt it yet...It's been continuously plugged in since friday night charging my other phones as well...i will suggest they better check there electrical connections (use with extension boards which removes spike) In simple words i will say...just go for it...you will love it

filpkart.comment: Flipkart Service awesome as usual. Earphones, received defective since day 1. Most of the times the phone doesn't detect earphones and sounds still play on loudspeaker after connecting them. Even if you manage to somehow adjust it to work, just touch the pin or even the cable and BAM!!! Gone again! Will have to go through the pains of going to the Customer Care and get them replaced I suppose. The phone worked just fine with KitKat though shortcuts not so wisely chosen I'd say. And then came the biggest nightmare, Android L. It will be better than KitKat in future may be. But right now, its JUST NOT READY. Google should not have released it if it wasn't ready. So full of bugs, shortcuts and usage-wise dumber than ever. Here's a list of bugs or things I didn't like. The list is by no means exhaustive ;) There is NO "Silent Mode" it seems. The moment you turn the volume down, it will vibrate no matter what you settings are. It has a notification panel like usual, but still shows new notifications as popups at the top and couldn't find a way to disable it. If you want to toggle mobile data, you have to at least make 4 touches. Tried a few apps for shortcuts but the data toggle didn't seem to work. Google Now launcher simply looks "UGLY". The notification pull down is refreshing with a whole new transparent look but the moment you open app drawer, its got this white background with ugly big icons as if you've installed Windows on PC but forgot to install Video drivers. Weird! Battery graph makes it more difficult to understand how long it has been since last charge. When you press on the "Phone" icon, it takes considerable time to open up. Even if it doesn't, place a call from there to the last number or from Recents menu you'll notice a clear delay. Long touch the power button and the only option you get is Power Off. Not even restart, or sound profiles or anything. And it doesn't even ask for confirmation when you touch Power Off. Many animations are not smooth and clearly lag. For instance, the one when you close the app drawer. Lockscreen shortcuts cannot be customized anymore. It gives only 2 shortcuts by default, camera and phone. Now, a few icons and apps they've really changed to suit the new material design concept but the default sms app still has the same old icon which feels like the odd man out ;-) There are many more bugs which I couldn't think of while typing this review. In short, Android L is UNFINISHED. Yes, I did try factory reset too. Still no bugs solved. In fact, doesn't even ask for code or anything during factory reset also. So basically anyone who gets hold of my device can reset my phone. Wow! So useful! I personally didn't even like the new look much. I prefer the good old KitKat, but that's something which really depends on individual tastes.

filpkart.comment: I don't buy phones often neither do I talk about it as I feel there are better things to talk about. Prior to owning Moto G I bought the Moto E to "taste" vanilla android and it was such a fulfilling experience that I finally bought the G as well. This is sec gen and so it is BIG (for me, coming from E) Apps and everything looks way better than this than E. Both front and rear camera is decent enough for a 13k phone. I exchanged my old Lumia 525 and got the G for 10k. Sweet deal imo :) This phone is fast, you will love the big screen, battery is okay, don't go only by mah, there is more to what the manufacturer claims always! Lasts me 15 hours with average usage. I am keeping the E as back up phone and will use this as primary. G came with Lollypop. I am facing navigation/GPS locking issues with G but it is a known issue with Lollypop not Moto G. Unfortunately the Sim slot 1 on my G went kaput so FK is shipping me a new one. I should get it by tomorrow evening. All in all a very good "best of all worlds" phone for 13k.
